title: Kth Smallest Element in a BST
description: Given the root of a binary search tree, and an integer k, return the kth smallest value (1-indexed) of all the values of the nodes in the tree.
constraints: The number of nodes in the tree is n.

brute-force.name: Brute Force
brute-force.description: Traverse in-order to get sorted elements.

steps.instruction: Define the function kth_smallest that takes root and k.
Initialize an empty stack to help with iterative in-order traversal.

steps.instruction: Initialize 'curr' as the current node, starting from the root.

steps.instruction: Loop while stack or curr is not None.

steps.instruction: Inner loop: Continue while 'curr' is not None to reach the leftmost ancestor.
steps.hint: In-order traversal starts by exploring the leftmost subtree as deep as possible.

steps.instruction: Push the current node onto the stack.
steps.hint: We store nodes on the stack to process them later in sorted order.

steps.instruction: Move to the left child of the current node.
steps.hint: Continue going down the left side until you reach a leaf.

steps.instruction: Pop the top node from the stack and make it the current node.
steps.hint: The stack ensures we process nodes in ascending order.

steps.instruction: Decrement k to track how many nodes we have processed.
steps.hint: Each time we pop a node, we are visiting the next smallest element.

steps.instruction: Check if k has reached zero, indicating we found the kth smallest element.
steps.hint: Since we started with k and decremented it for each node, reaching zero means success.

steps.instruction: Return the value of the current node.
